metadata.synopsis: Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.

134.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
134.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?

202.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
202.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?
202.context: InternalNodeContext: Do not put a selection speaker here, gith has priority

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Honestly? I'm not really a gith.

61.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
61.text: Tsk'va! You seek to impersonate us? To spy on us?

58.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
58.text: Baretha! Kill this fiend. I will continue to hunt for the weapon elsewhere.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: Play along as a gith. Say you're indeed from the crèche.

10.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
10.text: Lies. You speak like the vermin from this wretched world. What are you, a deserter?

168.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
168.text: No matter. Baretha! This one is no kin to us. Kill them. I will continue searching for the weapon.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Impersonate a fierce gith and refuse him any explanation.

196.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
196.text: Ha! Your tongue is sharp - good. The crèche's hatchlings have not been compromised by this meek, wretched world.

251.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
251.text: There is no conviction in your voice. What are you? A deserter? A traitor?

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Show deference. Bow and explain that you are lost.

101.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
101.text: Pa'vrylk! You twist our noble words with a coward's tongue!

213.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
213.text: This world has made you soft, like rotten fruit. I will not let you shame Vlaakith any longer...

34.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
34.text: Baretha! Rid us of this disgrace. I have to continue my hunt for the weapon.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I am no crèche hatchling. Do not speak to me as one.

114.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
114.text: Ha! Your tongue is still sharp - good. This soft world can dull our wits.

74.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
74.text: We must not linger among such cattle. Even their warriors' blood shames our blades.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Tell him about your parasite and ask for help.

240.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
240.text: I believe you, vin'iisk. No one would lie about such a thing.

7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
7.text: Your troubles are over; we shall help you. Baretha?

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Indeed. I came from the crèche.

201.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
201.text: Curious. Most coming from the crèche would come across this bridge behind me. You did not...

112.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
112.text: ...but I suppose you are young and untested. This world can be confounding to navigate.

191.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
191.text: You will return to the crèche and fetch reinforcements. But first, a question...

31.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
31.text: And in the company of local vermin...? Explain yourself, vin'iisk.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: These are my comrades. I will not stoop to explain my choice of company.

212.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
212.text: Insubordinate at best. A blood traitor and deserter at worst.

190.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
190.text: Baretha - kill them and search the bodies. I will hunt for the weapon elsewhere.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: They are my prisoners. I intend to bring them to the crèche for interrogation.

137.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
137.text: How diligent you are, vin'iisk. If only all of our queen's warriors served with such rigour.

95.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
95.text: Take them to the crèche. And see about fetching reinforcements. But first, a question...

1.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
1.text: We hunt a weapon, taken from the ghaik slave ship. Have you seen such an item?

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks is the same one the Absolute's followers are hunting - it's the artefact that she carries.*
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

252.speaker: Narrator
252.text: *Her mind focuses - the giths' suspicion cannot be aroused. They cannot discover that the weapon they seek is right within their grasp.*
252.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes flick over to the hobgoblin.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I need to know more. What is its appearance? Its purpose?

68.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
68.text: It is polyhedric in shape, inscribed with the sacred runes of our people. It is our queen's, and she shall have it back.

188.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
188.text: Clearly you know nothing of this, vin'iisk. No matter, it will be found. Make for the crèche.

6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
6.text: And if you come across any survivors of the ghaik vessel, kill them and search them. Thoroughly.

21.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
21.text: Baretha - keep hunting. And do better. Qudenos - we fly!

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I don't know of such a weapon.

203.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
203.text: No matter. More spears will make short work of this hunt. Make for the crèche.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: Produce the artefact. Ask him if this is what he seeks.

84.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
84.text: It cannot be... You have the weapon? Someone would have reported it to me.

222.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
222.text: Unless... unless you carried it off the ghaik ship yourself.

187.speaker: Narrator
187.text: *You realise he is casting Detect Thoughts. You feel him rummaging in your head already.*

163.speaker: Narrator
163.text: *You feel a presence in your head - the kith'rak's presence. Your tadpole recoils defensively.*

24.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
24.text: ...It is true. You were corrupted by the filthy spawn of the ghaik. Yet you still retrieved our queen's weapon.

64.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
64.text: You have done well, in spite of your affliction. Allow me to reward you. Baretha?

22.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
22.text: Kill them. Make it swift and clean.

184.speaker: Narrator
184.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks - it's the artefact that she carries.*
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You must keep it from him, just as you must keep it from the Absolute.*
165.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

146.speaker: Narrator
146.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You cannot let him discover it - no matter what.*

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *You suddenly feel a strange anxiety take hold - not your own, but that of the artefact you carry. Somehow, it's afraid...*
211.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

205.speaker: Narrator
205.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands any more than it does the Absolute followers'.*
205.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to part from you. It does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands.*

144.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
144.text: Your lips spill falsehoods! You have taken on the soft, cowardly ways of this world.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: These are local guides. I'll get rid of them once they cease to be useful.

83.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
83.text: Cunning. You will do well, vin'iisk.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: In the gith tongue, explain that they are local guides - to be killed once they cease to be useful.

233.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
233.text: Treacherous shka'keth! Baretha - deal with this! I will continue the hunt elsewhere.

263.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
263.text: What easy prey you make, walking right within my blade's embrace.

153.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
153.text: These creatures are so simple to ensnare, Baretha. You mewl too much about your task.

116.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
116.text: And as for you, tell me - why shouldn't I run you through this instant?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Silently hold his stare and discreetly prepare to attack.

18.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
18.text: Hmm. You make good use of silence. Too many think hot air will save them...

25.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
25.text: If I have no use for you alive, I'll have your death, slow and sweet. Understand?

268.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
268.text: ...You think I don't see that pathetic fumbling?

173.speaker: Player
173.text: You would've done so already if you didn't want something from me first.

223.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
223.text: Perceptive, for such an inferior creature.

253.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
253.text: For you to keep sucking air, it is necessary for you to tell me something of worth.

80.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
80.text: A vessel fell from the sky. We seek a precious weapon that was taken from it.

249.speaker: Narrator
249.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks is the same one the Absolute's followers are hunting - it's the artefact that she carries.*
249.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks - it's the artefact that she carries.*
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

105.speaker: Narrator
105.text: *Her mind focuses - the giths' suspicion cannot be aroused. They cannot discover that the weapon they seek is right within their grasp.*
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes flick over to the hobgoblin.

59.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
59.text: Help us find it and I will leave your blood beneath your skin, unspilled.

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: Don't help them. Don't tell them a thing. We're dead if you do.

170.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
170.text: Of course! Obedience is your only hope. Now stand still...

90.speaker: Player
90.text: You'll need to start from the beginning - what is this weapon you're after?

106.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
106.text: Do not speak. Your bleating offends my ears. Just stand still...

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Produce the artefact. Ask if this is what he seeks.

194.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
194.text: Just like that, you offer up what I seek. Remarkable. You have my thanks.

169.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
169.text: In gratitude, I'll grant you a swift death. Baretha? You know what to do.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I might know something. But it'll cost you.

245.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
245.text: You haggle with your own life, fool. Be silent and hold still...

104.speaker: Narrator
104.text: *He begins to move his hand in a quick flurry of gestures.*
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: #	Dialog/ Scene	NodeGUID	Character Type & Sex 	Shot Name	Clips	Notes (Please include props here) 	Selects	Status	Record Date	Complexity 	Clean Up Length	Date Expected Final In Engine?NodeContext: Narration.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Silently interpret the meaning of the gestures.

29.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
29.text: Ts'kva! You carry a ghaik parasite in your head! Death will be a kindness to you...

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Resist the probing into your mind.

209.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
209.text: Bah! Nothing even approaching a useful thought in that skull. I ought to just kill you...

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Don't be too hasty. I could prove very useful.

81.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
81.text: Unlikely. But it costs me nothing to spare your sorry life.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: I could help if you let me live - search for this weapon, perhaps.

195.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
195.text: Unlikely you'd be successful... but it costs me nothing to spare your sorry life.

120.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
120.text: Help? Absurd. You're already a hindrance, wasting my time.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Why are you hesitating, then? Try it, I dare you.

218.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
218.text: So bold in the face of death... Perhaps you may live after all.

12.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
12.text: Better to let stronger blood thrive. It can give rise to worthier foes and hardier slaves. Don't disappoint me.

219.speaker: Player
219.text: You ought to just leave. You've no right to decide my fate.

231.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
231.text: My blade is my right. If I can take your life, it is mine. But perhaps you have other uses...

243.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
243.text: Very well, istik. Seek out survivors from the ship that crashed on this wretched world.

147.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
147.text: Bring me their heads. Bring me the weapon. If you succeed, the reward will be great.

2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
2.text: I have every right: I am strong, you are weak.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: You saw how ruthlessly I pursue my goals. I can help you.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: My fate is my own. You will not take it from me.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Give it a try. I'm hungry for a little fun.

5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
5.text: A worthless kill - no sport. If this one was even slightly useful, I might spare them...
5.context: NodeContext: 'Voss' refers to Baretha's superior, who had recently chastised her lack of progress while the player observed from afar.

14.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
14.text: You think you can worm your way into my head, simpleton?

102.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
102.text: Baretha! Show this worm its place. I need to continue my hunt.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Don't be foolish. I have powerful allies.

166.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
166.text: Then they can mourn for you.

15.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
15.text: Baretha! Rid us of this worm. I need to continue the hunt for the weapon.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: A corpse is useless. But a living informant might unearth something.

89.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
89.text: Curious. I thought even the lowest of creatures had at least a shred of dignity. You prove me wrong.

32.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
32.text: But there's a repellent logic in your words. You may notice things a noble gith does not.

86.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
86.text: Baretha! Kill this insolent worm. I need to continue my hunt.

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *The gestures mean nothing to you - some sort of spell that you don't recognise.*

167.speaker: Player
167.text: He is casting Detect Thoughts - steel your mind to resist it.

257.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
257.text: Well now. If you are of no use to me alive, I'll have your death.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Lie. Claim you saw bandits loot a wreck, then set off to the west.

208.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
208.text: Oh you saw something, did you? Let us see exactly what these bandits took...

262.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
262.text: Help us find it and I will leave your blood beneath your skin, unspilled.

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You must keep it from him, just as you must keep it from the Absolute.*
123.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

241.speaker: Narrator
241.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You cannot let him discover it - no matter what.*

238.speaker: Narrator
238.text: *You suddenly feel a strange anxiety take hold - not your own, but that of the artefact you carry. Somehow, it's afraid...*
238.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

235.speaker: Narrator
235.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands any more than it does the Absolute followers'.*
235.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to part from you. It does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands.*

0.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
0.text: I want something, yes. But I don't need you to be drawing breath in order to take it...

260.speaker: Player
260.text: I just want passage - if I have to go through you, so be it.

154.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
154.text: Chk! You dare speak to me like my better? Others have died for lesser insults - slowly.

141.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
141.text: But your bravery amuses me. Finally I find a wolf in a world of lowing cattle...

9.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
9.text: You may live. For the moment.

128.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
128.text: Now, we seek a weapon, taken from a vessel that fell from the sky. Understand, istik?

3.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
3.text: I gave you a chance to save your hide. Instead you chose empty bluster.

204.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
204.text: You are a waste of flesh. Perhaps the worms will have use for you.

179.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
179.text: Senseless creature - I don't want to dull my blade on your overly thick skull.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: I don't know you. I pose no threat.

28.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
28.text: Of course you are not a threat! You are nothing until I tell you otherwise.

189.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
189.text: Threat? Pah! You threaten me no more than the insects scrambling in the dirt.
189.context: NodeContext: Amused indignation - she can't believe you think you are worth anything

250.speaker: Player
250.text: Can't you muster a real threat, like flaying or blinding?

192.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
192.text: Chk! I can devise torments beyond your reckoning, rest assured. But time is pressing.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: Try it - let's see who walks away alive.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Claim you're an important person. A valuable hostage - or ally.

45.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
45.text: No creature from this wretched world is important, half-wit.

36.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
36.text: The only value you hold is as meat to the carrion birds.

266.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
266.text: Now, now, child - your pet means to speak. Tell me, pet: why shouldn't I run you through this instant?
